subject: Handbrake issue
description_text:
Hello after 2 months my handbrake disconected from pc, reinstall the .exe
but still the problem :( what to do..i send you a pics

conversations.body_text: Hi Kamen Krustev,    Does the software show any piracy warnings when it starts or when you plug in the USB?

No nothing and the lights is still working when i put usb to pc but show
not connected

Then just provide your ID and temporary password.      https://dl.todesk.com/windows/ToDesk_Setup.exe

На чт, 17.07.2025 г. в 11:52 service@simsonn.com

In fact, everything screwed up when I went to calibrate the pedals, it
constantly started to write to me that they are connected and disconnected,
they light up, but they are no longer reflected in the game, only the
handbrake work, until finally it stuck my computer and now it rejects my
USB ports and I have neither a mouse nor a keyboard :(

На чт, 17.07.2025 г. в 12:46 service@simsonn.com

Hi Kamen Krustev,    If your computer uses a two-prong plug (without a ground pin), grounding will be ineffective. We recommend connecting your computer to a properly grounded three-prong outlet to ensure reliable anti-interference performance.  In practice, after playing for a while, touching metal parts again may cause static discharge — in mild cases, you may feel a small shock; in more serious cases, static buildup in the base can interfere with other USB devices.  Please refer to the grounding instructions below to enhance stability and reduce interference.     Anti-interference Solutions: 1. Ensure your PC is properly grounded through a functional household ground line Some wall outlets only have two wires and lack a ground wire. This not only poses a safety risk but also prevents devices like Fanatec from discharging electromagnetic interference (EMI) effectively. 2. Use a wire to connect the metal housing of your wheel stand or base to the metal case of your PC This creates a shielding path that significantly improves the overall EMI resistance. 3. Connect a green shielded wire from the metal casing of the pedal control box to any metal screw on the pedal This ensures a solid electrical connection between the control box and the pedal to reduce signal drift and noise. 4. Use a USB isolator If interference persists, consider using a USB isolator to further block EMI transmission paths. ⚠ Note: Make sure all connection points are on bare metal surfaces. Painted or oxidized areas can result in poor grounding, reducing the effectiveness of the shielding.        https://github.com/SHWotever/SimHub/wiki/USB-Issues-Troubleshooting     https://support.gomezsimindustries.com/portal/en/kb/articles/understanding-emi-and-grounding
everything is fine

i just watch youtube clip for solving problem with disconnect i
reconnecd usb port problem for asseto corsa and solve it, 10x for support
...im waiting for  VAM Pro Linear Motor delivery  :)

Hi Kamen Krustev,    As long as it has a USB 3.0 interface and an independent power supply, most models purchased from Amazon should work without any issues.  In SIMSONN Manager 2.0.9, go to the Update section and click on "Manual Firmware Update." Then navigate to the handbrake-firmware folder, open the handbrake subfolder, and select the hbpro.sfu file to update the firmware.
